main event: An unidentified object was observed in the sky over Karthus, Pennsylvania, on June 1, 1967, believed to be a man-made satellite.
interesting points: The object was described as batch white and three times brighter than the brightest satellite observed,The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes,The observer was Dr. Boris, a WWII pilot with astronomy training,The object exhibited rapid movement before fading out of sight,Previous sightings of similar objects occurred but were not as bright.
witness description: Dr. Boris, a male pilot with a background in astronomy
